message:
Correctness_Score: 0.2
Style_Score: 0.7
Simplicity_Score: 0.3
Robustness_Score: 0.2
Reasoning: The algorithm's logic for checking if two couples can be made adjacent is correct (the BFS over the four positions explores all distributions), but the overall solution is brute-force O(N^2) over couples and will time out on large inputs so it would fail many judge test cases. Style is reasonable: function decomposition, a helpful docstring and inline comments in the helper, and clear variable names. The implementation is not simple or concise — the BFS and double loop are unnecessary because the adjacency condition can be checked directly from the four positions — resulting in redundant work. Robustness is low because the approach does not scale to the input limits and has no safeguards or optimizations for large N.
